Name: Azure DevOps Services
Developed or used CDE: Azure DevOps Services Microsoft Visual Studio
Notes: Most features are free for open source projects or teams of 5 members or less[2]

Name: Bitbucket
Notes: Denies service to Cuba  Iran  North Korea  Sudan and Syria

Name: Buddy
Notes: Cloud version free for 1 project with no limit on size. Self-hosted version free up to 10 users with Fair Source license[3] applied.

Name: Gitea
Notes: Gitea is an open-source software tool funded on Open Collective that is designed for self-hosting  but also provides a free first-party instance.

Name: GForge
Developed or used CDE: Cloud version – free up to 5 users. On-premises version - free up to 5 users.
Notes: GForge is free for open source projects.

Name: GitLab
Developed or used CDE: GitLab Community Edition (CE) — free software GitLab Enterprise Edition (EE) — proprietary
Notes: Denies Service to Crimea  Cuba  Iran  North Korea  Sudan  and Syria[9]

Name: GNU Savannah
Notes: Project by the Free Software Foundation and projects with a GPL compatible license. Staff must approve requests for project approval  deletion  and so forth  which can take time if staffing levels are low. Code access review[10]

Name: Helix TeamHub
Developed or used CDE: Cloud version – free up to 5 users. On-premises version requires a license.
Notes: Free cloud version has no limits on projects within 5gb storage limit. On-premises version has DevOps pipeline technology and free replicas.

Name: Launchpad
Notes: Supports Bazaar and Git for version-controlled repository hosting.[11][12]

Name: Ourproject.org
Notes: For free software  free culture and free content projects.

Name: Rosetta Code
Notes: Programming chrestomathy wiki for common algorithms

Name: SourceForge
Notes: For open-source projects only.[16] Denies service when accessed from Cuba  Iran  North Korea  Sudan  Syria[17]

Name: Helix TeamHub
column13: Yes  with hooks. Jenkins  TeamCity  etc.

Name: freedesktop.org
Require free software on registration: Only for interoperability and shared base technology for free software desktop environments on Gnu and other Unix-like operating systems  including the X Window System (X11) and cairo (graphics).
